data.content: Fiction Friday
https://miro.medium.com/max/10336/0*_56Rzl4CTQN9s_Rw

I’m in love with my best friend, Leo. But Leo is absolutely disinterested in me. I mean, I’m a nerd who never dates while Leo has a new girl on his arm each week. You could call our friendship a fluke. We were both nerdy in middle school, but now Leo’s a super popular senior…While nobody cares I exist.
Leo: Ready for Prom?
Leo sits at our lunch table. He has soft red bangs and piercing green eyes.
Leo: I hear it’s ocean themed. Look who’s prepared.
With a devious smile, Leo pulls a lobster bowtie from his backpack.
Matilda: Perfect!
He won’t like what follows.
Matilda: But I’m not going.
Leo looks stunned.
We used to fantasize about Prom. But that’s when I still had a shot with him.
Leo: You have to go, Matilda. It’s Senior Prom!
Even though we’re best friends, Leo forgets how much more popular he is.
Leo: Wait. Why aren’t you going? Has nobody asked?
Matilda: Bingo.
That’s not exactly true. Simon asked me last month.
But he isn’t Leo, so I declined. He wouldn’t stop my heartache.
Matilda: I won’t go to Prom alone.
Leo: It’s not hard to find a date, Matilda.
Matilda: Maybe not for you. You’re Mr. Popular now. But nobody asked me.
As Leo scrunches his brow and gazes at me, he looks a bit like a Professor.
Leo: So nobody’s asked you…You can still ask a guy!
He says it so excitedly, but I don’t want anyone but him.
Matilda: I don’t know, Leo. I get shy about that stuff.
Leo’s face turns gentle.
Leo: What if you were more comfortable?
Matilda: But how? I’m not like you. Dating doesn’t come easily to me.
Leo: I’ll help you.
I let out a laugh.
Matilda: You mean help me date?
Leo: I’ll give you advice! Your own personal dating professor!
I feel my cheeks reddening.
Matilda: Don’t worry about it. I’m just not going to Prom.
Leo: But I DO worry about you, Matilda.
I feel a lump in my throat.
Leo cares about me, clearly. Just not enough to ask me out.
Matilda: How would you tutor me?
Leo: Imagine I’m a guy you like.
Oof. That’s not hard.
Matilda: Okay.
Leo: What would you say?
I look in Leo’s eyes. Deeply.
Matilda: Leo, do you have a date for Prom?
Leo: Not yet. Why?
Matilda: Would you like to go with me?
It’s silent enough to hear a pin drop.
And then Leo claps.
Leo: You nailed it!
I let out my breath.
For a second…I thought he’d say yes. I’m so ridiculous.
Leo: Now you know what to do! So what’s the hang up?
Matilda: It’s not just the asking. It’s the whole Prom thing. I mean…
I lower my eyes.
Matilda: I can’t dance.
Not to mention kiss.
Leo puts on his Professor’s face again.
Leo: Let me show you that too.
Matilda: Really?
Leo: Can I take you on a fake date?
Matilda: I fake accept.
Leo knocks on my door to pick me up.
We’re both dressed for a dance. But really, we’re going to Leo’s basement.
He puts on a loud pop song and lets loose. I watch him, feeling awkward.
Leo: Just do as I do!
I copy him. And as I move to the beat, I actually feel really free.
Of course, seeing Leo’s glorious body move helps.
But now the playlist moves to a slow song.
Matilda: I-I don’t know about this.
Leo puts his arms around my waist.
Leo: I’ve got you. Put your arms around me.
I put my arms around his waist.
Matilda: Like that?
Leo: Try my neck.
He winks and I blush crimson.
But I still hold him, grazing his neck. His skin is soft and smooth.
Leo: Now we dance.
As we sway to the music, I realize this is it.
The closest we’ll ever get.
Leo: What’s wrong? Did I step on you?
Matilda: No, it’s perfect.
Too perfect.
No other man will ever compare.
Leo: Mission accomplished, eh? Now you can ask a guy!
I can’t hold it in anymore.
A tear drops from my eye as Leo stares right at me.
Leo: What’s wrong, Matilda?
Matilda: I’ve been hiding something from you…Simon asked me to Prom last month and I said I wasn’t going.
Leo: But why?
I brace myself.
Matilda: Because I love you, Leo.
We stop swaying.
Matilda: Did I just ruin things?
I take my hands off his neck.
Matilda: I’m sorry.
Leo: Don’t be.
Leo brushes his lips against mine.
Leo: I love you too.
Matilda: But you go on so many dates…
Leo: You’re my best friend, Matilda. I was scared. If you didn’t feel the same way, it could’ve ruined our friendship.
He actually blushes now.
Leo: And with those other dates, I just wanted to seem desirable to you.
I couldn’t hide my grin if I tried.
Matilda: You’ve always been desirable to me.
We gaze in each other’s eyes.
Matilda: What now?
Leo: What did Professor Leo teach?
I burst into laughter.
Matilda: Leo, will you go to Prom with me?
Leo: You nailed it.
Leo and I go to Prom together.
He’s adorable in his lobster bowtie and I’m in a green dress as seaweed.
Our friends are thrilled to see us arm in arm. They ask how it happened…
And I say, I had the best teacher.
